TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Timer : MarshalByRefObject, IDisposable

Public NotInheritable Class Timer Inherits MarshalByRefObject Implements IDisposable
public ref class Timer sealed : MarshalByRefObject, IDisposable
type Timer = class inherit MarshalByRefObject interface IDisposable

summary.span: 提供一套機制，可於指定間隔在執行緒集區執行緒上執行方法。

span.span: Provides a mechanism for executing a method on a thread pool thread at specified intervals.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用來指定您想要的方法委派來執行。Use a delegate to specify the method you want the to execute. 簽章委派：The signature of the delegate is: ```csharp void TimerCallback(Object state) ``` ```cpp void TimerCallback(Object state) ``` ```vb Sub TimerCallback(state As Object) ``` 當計時器建構，而且無法變更，會指定計時器委派。The timer delegate is specified when the timer is constructed, and cannot be changed. 此方法不會建立計時器; 在執行緒上執行它會執行上系統所提供的執行緒。The method does not execute on the thread that created the timer; it executes on a thread supplied by the system. > [!TIP] > .NET 包含四個類別，名為`Timer`，每個的提供不同的功能：.NET includes four classes named `Timer`, each of which offers different functionality: > > - 這會引發事件，並在其中執行程式碼或定期的更多的事件接收。, which fires an event and executes the code in one or more event sinks at regular intervals. 此類別被為了做為以伺服器為基礎，或在多執行緒環境; 中的服務元件它沒有使用者介面，並在執行階段看不到。The class is intended for use as a server-based or service component in a multithreaded environment; it has no user interface and is not visible at runtime. > - 它就會在固定間隔在執行緒集區執行緒上執行的單一回呼方法。, which executes a single callback method on a thread pool thread at regular intervals. 計時器會具現化，而且無法加以變更，被定義回呼方法。The callback method is defined when the timer is instantiated and cannot be changed. 例如類別，這個類別是做為伺服器或服務的元件，在多執行緒環境中用於; 它沒有使用者介面，並在執行階段看不到。Like the class, this class is intended for use as a server-based or service component in a multithreaded environment; it has no user interface and is not visible at runtime. > - (僅限.NET framework)，Windows Forms 元件引發事件，並在一或多個事件接收器，定期執行程式碼。 (.NET Framework only), a Windows Forms component that fires an event and executes the code in one or more event sinks at regular intervals. 元件沒有使用者介面，而且是用於單一執行緒的環境;它會在 UI 執行緒上執行。The component has no user interface and is designed for use in a single-threaded environment; it executes on the UI thread. > - (僅限.NET framework)，以固定間隔執行非同步或同步網頁回傳的 ASP.NET 元件。 (.NET Framework only), an ASP.NET component that performs asynchronous or synchronous web page postbacks at a regular interval. 當您建立計時器時，您可以指定的方法第一次執行之前要等待的時間量 （到期時間），以及後續的執行作業 （句點） 之間要等候的時間量。When you create a timer, you can specify an amount of time to wait before the first execution of the method (due time), and an amount of time to wait between subsequent executions (period). 類別具有相同的解析度，以系統時鐘。The class has the same resolution as the system clock. 這表示，如果長度小於系統時鐘的解析度委派將在大約 15 毫秒在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系統系統時鐘的解析度所定義的時間間隔執行。This means that if the period is less than the resolution of the system clock, the delegate will execute at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems. 您可以變更到期時間和期間或停用計時器，使用方法。You can change the due time and period, or disable the timer, by using the method. > [!NOTE] > 只要您使用，您必須保持它的參考。As long as you are using a , you must keep a reference to it. 如同任何受管理的物件，時不有任何參考受限於記憶體回收。As with any managed object, a is subject to garbage collection when there are no references to it. 事實上，時仍作用中不會防止它所收集。The fact that a is still active does not prevent it from being collected. 若不再需要計時器，使用計時器所持有的方法來釋放資源。When a timer is no longer needed, use the method to free the resources held by the timer. 請注意回呼可能會發生之後方法多載呼叫，因為計時器佇列中由執行緒集區執行緒執行的回呼。Note that callbacks can occur after the method overload has been called, because the timer queues callbacks for execution by thread pool threads. 您可以使用等候，直到所有的回呼已完成的方法多載。You can use the method overload to wait until all callbacks have completed. 計時器所執行的回呼方法應該是可重新進入，因為已呼叫方法執行緒。The callback method executed by the timer should be reentrant, because it is called on threads. 如果計時器間隔小於執行回呼中，所需的時間，或如果所有的執行緒集區正在使用中，回呼會排入佇列多次，則可以在兩個執行緒集區執行緒上同時執行的回呼。The callback can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the callback, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the callback is queued multiple times. > [!NOTE] > 是簡單、 輕量的計時器，會使用回呼方法，並由執行緒集區。 is a simple, lightweight timer that uses callback methods and is served by thread pool threads. 不建議用於 Windows Form，因為其回呼不會發生在使用者介面執行緒上。It is not recommended for use with Windows Forms, because its callbacks do not occur on the user interface thread. 是較好的選擇，以搭配 Windows Form。 is a better choice for use with Windows Forms. 如需伺服器為基礎的計時器功能，您可以考慮使用，這會引發事件，並提供額外的功能。For server-based timer functionality, you might consider using , which raises events and has additional features. ## Examples 下列範例會定義`StatusChecker`類別，其中包含`CheckStatus`其簽章是相同的方法為委派。The following example defines a `StatusChecker` class that includes a `CheckStatus` method whose signature is the same as the delegate. `state`引數`CheckStatus`方法是物件，用來同步處理應用程式執行緒和執行緒集區執行緒執行回呼委派。The `state` argument of the `CheckStatus` method is an object that is used to synchronize the application thread and the thread pool thread that executes the callback delegate. `StatusChecker`類別也包含兩個狀態變數：The `StatusChecker` class also includes two state variables: `invokeCount` 表示叫用回呼方法的次數。Indicates the number of times the callback method has been invoked. `maxCount` 決定應叫用回呼方法最大次數。Determines the maximum number of times the callback method should be invoked. 應用程式執行緒會建立計時器，它會等待一秒，然後執行`CheckStatus`回呼方法每 250 毫秒。The application thread creates the timer, which waits one second and then executes the `CheckStatus` callback method every 250 milliseconds. 然後，應用程式執行緒會封鎖直到物件收到訊號。The application thread then blocks until the object is signaled. 當`CheckStatus`回呼方法會執行`maxCount`次，它會呼叫`AutoResetEvent.Set`方法，以設定狀態的物件已收到訊號。When the `CheckStatus` callback method executes `maxCount` times, it calls the `AutoResetEvent.Set` method to set the state of the object to signaled. 第一次發生這種情況，應用程式執行緒呼叫方法以便在回呼方法現在會執行每個半秒。The first time this happens, the application thread calls the method so that the callback method now executes every half second. 同樣地封鎖直到物件收到訊號。It once again blocks until the object is signaled. 當發生這種情況時，計時器會終結藉由呼叫其方法，以及應用程式會終止。When this happens, the timer is destroyed by calling its method, and the application terminates. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: This type is thread safe.

summary.span: 以無限週期和無限到期時間初始化 類別的新執行個體，利用新建立 物件做為狀態物件。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with an infinite period and an infinite due time, using the newly created object as the state object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 呼叫這個建構函式，當您想要使用物件本身做為狀態物件。Call this constructor when you want to use the object itself as the state object. 建立計時器之後, 使用方法來設定到期時間與間隔。After creating the timer, use the method to set the interval and due time. 這個建構函式會指定無限到期時間之前的第一個回呼與回呼，以防止第一個回呼之前發生無限間隔物件指派給狀態物件。This constructor specifies an infinite due time before the first callback and an infinite interval between callbacks, in order to prevent the first callback from occurring before the object is assigned to the state object. 為指定的方法`callback`應該是可重新進入，，因為它呼叫執行緒。The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on threads. 如果計時器的間隔少於一個執行方法，所需的時間，或如果所有的執行緒集區正在使用中，此方法會排入佇列多次，則可以在兩個執行緒集區執行緒上同時執行的方法。The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會建立新的計時器，並使用計時器本身做為狀態物件。The following code example creates a new timer, using the timer itself as the state object. 方法用來啟動計時器。The method is used to start the timer. 計時器回撥時，狀態物件用來關閉計時器。When the timer callback occurs, the state object is used to turn the timer off. [!code-csharp[TimerSelfCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Misc/timerSelfCtor/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[TimerSelfCtor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Misc/timerSelfCtor/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: The amount of time to delay before callback is invoked, in milliseconds.

param.span: 指定 以防止計時器啟動。

span.span: Specify to prevent the timer from starting.

param.span: 指定零 (0) 以立即啟動計時器。

summary.span: 初始化 類別的新執行個體，使用 32 位元帶正負號的整數來指定時間間隔。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class, using a 32-bit signed integer to specify the time interval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所指定的委派`callback`參數會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每次`period`時間間隔經過。The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses. 如果`dueTime`為零 (0)，`callback`會立即叫用。If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`已，`callback`不會叫用; 計時器已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用方法。If `dueTime` is , `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the method. 因為類別具有相同的解析度，以系統時鐘，也就是在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系統上大約 15 毫秒，`callback`委派執行，如果系統時鐘的解析度所定義的間隔`period`小於系統時鐘的解析度。Because the class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或並`dueTime`不是，`callback`會叫用週期性的計時器行為一次; 已停用，但可以重新啟用使用方法。If `period` is zero (0) or and `dueTime` is not , `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the method. 為指定的方法`callback`應該是可重新進入，，因為它呼叫執行緒。The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on threads. 如果計時器的間隔少於一個執行方法，所需的時間，或如果所有的執行緒集區正在使用中，此方法會排入佇列多次，則可以在兩個執行緒集區執行緒上同時執行的方法。The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何建立`TimerCallback`委派，並初始化的新執行個體`Timer`類別。The following code example shows how to create a `TimerCallback` delegate and initialize a new instance of the `Timer` class. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/VB/source.vb#1)]

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class, using 64-bit signed integers to measure time intervals.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所指定的委派`callback`參數會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每次`period`時間間隔經過。The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses. 如果`dueTime`為零 (0)，`callback`會立即叫用。If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`已，`callback`不會叫用; 計時器已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用方法。If `dueTime` is , `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the method. 因為類別具有相同的解析度，以系統時鐘，也就是在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系統上大約 15 毫秒，`callback`委派執行，如果系統時鐘的解析度所定義的間隔`period`小於系統時鐘的解析度。Because the class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或並`dueTime`不是，`callback`會叫用週期性的計時器行為一次; 已停用，但可以重新啟用使用方法。If `period` is zero (0) or and `dueTime` is not , `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the method. 為指定的方法`callback`應該是可重新進入，，因為它呼叫執行緒。The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on threads. 如果計時器的間隔少於一個執行方法，所需的時間，或如果所有的執行緒集區正在使用中，此方法會排入佇列多次，則可以在兩個執行緒集區執行緒上同時執行的方法。The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class, using values to measure time intervals.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所指定的委派`callback`參數會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每次`period`時間間隔經過。The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses. 如果`dueTime`為零 (0)，`callback`會立即叫用。If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`為負一 (-1) 毫秒，`callback`不會叫用; 計時器已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用方法。If `dueTime` is negative one (-1) milliseconds, `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the method. 因為類別具有相同的解析度，以系統時鐘，也就是在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系統上大約 15 毫秒，`callback`委派執行，如果系統時鐘的解析度所定義的間隔`period`小於系統時鐘的解析度。Because the class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或負一 (-1) 毫秒並`dueTime`是正數，`callback`叫用週期性的計時器行為一次; 已停用，但可以重新啟用使用方法。If `period` is zero (0) or negative one (-1) milliseconds and `dueTime` is positive, `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the method. 為指定的方法`callback`應該是可重新進入，，因為它呼叫執行緒。The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on threads. 如果計時器的間隔少於一個執行方法，所需的時間，或如果所有的執行緒集區正在使用中，此方法會排入佇列多次，則可以在兩個執行緒集區執行緒上同時執行的方法。The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何建立`TimerCallback`委派，並初始化的新執行個體`Timer`類別。The following code example shows how to create a `TimerCallback` delegate and initialize a new instance of the `Timer` class. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Timer2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer2/CPP/source2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Timer2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer2/CS/source2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Timer2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer2/VB/source2.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 所指定的委派`callback`參數會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每次`period`時間間隔經過。The delegate specified by the `callback` parameter is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the `period` time interval elapses. 如果`dueTime`為零 (0)，`callback`會立即叫用。If `dueTime` is zero (0), `callback` is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`已，`callback`不會叫用; 計時器已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用方法。If `dueTime` is , `callback` is not invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling the method. 因為類別具有相同的解析度，以系統時鐘，也就是在 Windows 7 和 Windows 8 的系統上大約 15 毫秒，`callback`委派執行，如果系統時鐘的解析度所定義的間隔`period`小於系統時鐘的解析度。Because the class has the same resolution as the system clock, which is approximately 15 milliseconds on Windows 7 and Windows 8 systems, the `callback` delegate executes at intervals defined by the resolution of the system clock if `period` is less than the resolution of the system clock. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或並`dueTime`不是，`callback`會叫用週期性的計時器行為一次; 已停用，但可以重新啟用使用方法。If `period` is zero (0) or and `dueTime` is not , `callback` is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled using the method. 為指定的方法`callback`應該是可重新進入，，因為它呼叫執行緒。The method specified for `callback` should be reentrant, because it is called on threads. 如果計時器的間隔少於一個執行方法，所需的時間，或如果所有的執行緒集區正在使用中，此方法會排入佇列多次，則可以在兩個執行緒集區執行緒上同時執行的方法。The method can be executed simultaneously on two thread pool threads if the timer interval is less than the time required to execute the method, or if all thread pool threads are in use and the method is queued multiple times.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 回呼方法會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每個時間所指定的時間間隔`period`耗盡。The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses. 如果`dueTime`是零 (0)，會立即叫用回呼方法。If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`已，永遠不會叫用回呼方法，計時器已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用並指定為正值`dueTime`。If `dueTime` is , the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或，並`dueTime`不是、 回呼方法叫用一次; 已停用計時器定期行為，但可以重新啟用呼叫並指定為正值`period`.If `period` is zero (0) or , and `dueTime` is not , the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling and specifying a positive value for `period`. 方法可以從呼叫委派。The method can be called from the delegate. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何啟動`Timer`和固定數目的引動過程之後, 變更其週期。The following code example demonstrates how to start a `Timer` and, after a set number of invocations, change its period. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 回呼方法會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每個時間所指定的時間間隔`period`耗盡。The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses. 如果`dueTime`是零 (0)，會立即叫用回呼方法。If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`為負一 (-1) 毫秒，絕不會叫用回呼方法，停用計時器，不過也可以藉由呼叫重新啟用並指定為正值`dueTime`。If `dueTime` is negative one (-1) milliseconds, the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或負一 (-1) 毫秒，並`dueTime`是正數，一次叫用回呼方法; 週期性的計時器行為已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用和指定的值大於為零`period`。If `period` is zero (0) or negative one (-1) milliseconds, and `dueTime` is positive, the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling and specifying a value greater than zero for `period`. 方法可以從呼叫委派。The method can be called from the delegate. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何啟動`Timer`和固定數目的引動過程之後, 變更其週期。The following code example demonstrates how to start a `Timer` and, after a set number of invocations, change its period. remarks.format: ## Remarks 回呼方法會叫用一次之後`dueTime`過後，而且之後每個時間所指定的時間間隔`period`耗盡。The callback method is invoked once after `dueTime` elapses, and thereafter each time the time interval specified by `period` elapses. 如果`dueTime`是零 (0)，會立即叫用回呼方法。If `dueTime` is zero (0), the callback method is invoked immediately. 如果`dueTime`已，永遠不會叫用回呼方法，計時器已停用，但可以藉由呼叫重新啟用並指定為正值`dueTime`。If `dueTime` is , the callback method is never invoked; the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling and specifying a positive value for `dueTime`. 如果`period`為零 (0) 或，並`dueTime`不是、 回呼方法叫用一次; 已停用計時器定期行為，但可以重新啟用呼叫並指定為正值`period`.If `period` is zero (0) or , and `dueTime` is not , the callback method is invoked once; the periodic behavior of the timer is disabled, but can be re-enabled by calling and specifying a positive value for `period`. 方法可以從呼叫委派。The method can be called from the delegate.

summary.span: 將 目前的執行個體所使用的資源全部釋出。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 呼叫`Dispose`可讓所使用的資源重新配置用於其他用途。Calling `Dispose` allows the resources used by the to be reallocated for other purposes. 如需詳細資訊`Dispose`，請參閱 < [ 清除 Unmanaged 資源總](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。For more information about `Dispose`, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md). > [!NOTE] > 之後就可能發生的回呼方法多載呼叫，因為計時器佇列中由執行緒集區執行緒執行的回呼。Callbacks can occur after the method overload has been called, because the timer queues callbacks for execution by thread pool threads. 您可以使用等候，直到所有的回呼已完成的方法多載。You can use the method overload to wait until all callbacks have completed. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何釋放所持有的資源`Timer`。The following code example shows how to free the resources held by a `Timer`. [!code-cpp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Threading.Timer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Threading.Timer/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 呼叫`Dispose`可讓所使用的資源重新配置用於其他用途。Calling `Dispose` allows the resources used by the to be reallocated for other purposes. 如需詳細資訊`Dispose`，請參閱 < [ 清除 Unmanaged 資源總](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。For more information about `Dispose`, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md). 這個方法完成時，它會通知所指定`notifyObject`參數。使用此多載方法，如果您想要能夠封鎖，直到確定計時器已被處置為止。When this method completes, it signals the specified by the `notifyObject` parameter.Use this overload of the method if you want to be able to block until you are certain that the timer has been disposed. 所有目前排入佇列的回呼完成之前，不會處置計時器。The timer is not disposed until all currently queued callbacks have completed. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用回呼方法來設定`dueTime`參數設為零，可能發生競爭情形時方法多載會呼叫： 如果計時器佇列之前的新回呼方法多載那里偵測到沒有回呼排入佇列，會繼續封鎖，而新的回撥會排入佇列，且計時器已處置的否則為新的回撥呼叫時擲回方法。If the callback uses the method to set the `dueTime` parameter to zero, a race condition can occur when the method overload is called: If the timer queues a new callback before the method overload detects that there are no callbacks queued, continues to block; otherwise, the timer is disposed while the new callback is being queued, and an is thrown when the new callback calls the method.
